title: C2-Over-HTTP: An Educational C2 Framework
text:
Command and Control (C2) framework developed in Python

A Python-based educational Command and Control (C2) framework simulating a client implant, server, and live web dashboard. It uses a safe, automated typing simulator to demonstrate keylogging, jittered beaconing, and data exfiltration.
Repository is available at https://github.com/mmuratardag/CS_edu_C2_simulator

title: Omega WebApp
text:
WebApp for academic publication

A web app built with JavaScript to accompany the publication.
Ardag, M.M. (2025). Omega McDonald’s reliability. In Encyclopedia of Social Measurement, Second Edition
See the app here

title: Streamlit App that predicts Developer Profiles
text:
Developer Profiles with 2024 Stack Overflow Developer Survey’s AI Items

A Streamlit app that collects responses to AI survey items based on the Stack Overflow Developer survey from 2024 and predicts the respondent’s profile.
App: https://stack-overflow-developer-profiler-2024.streamlit.app/
Read the blog post: https://mmuratardag.github.io/blog_posts/so_ai_developer_profile.html

title: Face analysis using DeepFace
text:
Face analysis using DeepFace: face recognition, detecting gender and dominant emotion

Two project using the DeepFace library to analyze faces in images. The analysis includes detecting faces and predicting gender and emotions.
The first project with images is available at https://github.com/mmuratardag/DS_cv_deepface
The second project with video is available at https://github.com/mmuratardag/DS_cv_deepface_video

title: Tweet stream data pipeline for a Slackbot
text:
Dockerized data pipeline

An implementation of a dockerized data pipeline that sends randomized tweets about politics together with their sentiment scores
The Docker-Compose pipeline includes five containers.

collects tweets with the Twitter API and tweepy
stores the tweets in a MongoDB
applies an ETL job that

extracts the tweets from MongoDB
gets the sentiments of the texts with VADERSentiment

loads the tweets and their sentiment scores in a Postgres database
creates a Slackbot that post a randomly selected anonymized tweet from the Postgres database into a Slack channel.

See more here

title: Time series
text:
An applications of univariate and multivariate times series

Google offers Google trends topics – a group of already clustered search terms that share the same concept or entity.
Search terms underpinning five interrelated ideologies pulled from Google Trends topics data are examined to understand the best way to model the trends and relationships.
See more here

title: Attitudes towards COVID-19 and voting intention in Germany
text:
Feature engineering with psychometrics, used in machine and deep learning models

The project uncovers subgroups of voters in Germany utilizing their beliefs towards the effectiveness of government measures, reported compliance with a possible curfew, and trust in various institutions during the early stages of the Corona pandemic. The uncovered segments of voters predict their voting intentions with acceptable accuracy.
See more here

title: Sentiment Analysis Comparison
text:
Comparison of sentiment analysis conducted with a lexicon and rule-based dictionary and state-of-the-art pre-trained language models

vader compound sentiment scores and the classification obtained from Hugging Face’s cardiffnlp/twitter-xlm-roberta-base-sentiment transformer model are compared.
See more here

title: Portfolio
text:
Statistics, Data Science & Cybersecurity
See items here

title: Auto- & Explainable- ML
text:
Application of auto-ML and explainable-ML within the multi-platform H2O framework and DALEX

A cross-platform application of auto-ML and explainable-ML to investigate to what extent they might be compatible
See more here

title: Causal segmentation
text:
Estimating conditional average treatment effects for the heterogeneous groups in a sample

Expecting homogeneous effects from experimental treatments might border on naivety sometimes. Especially, if we have large samples in A/B testing. This project is an implementation of Netflix’s sherlock on a convenient sample of German voters.
See more here

title: Recommender system
text:
A movie recommender with a web interface

Together with Pietro Passarella, we built a movie recommender with a web interface utilizing the small movielens dataset.
See more here

title: Measuring organizational practices
text:
Deprecated!..

I no longer update or customize this measurement instrument. Please see RoBERTa-OrgCulture-Classifier as the alternative.
Measurement instrument for text data
What started as the boot camp graduation project turned into a mature product that assesses organizational culture from both employee reviews and company mission and vision statements.

The product helps to understand

the gap between a company’s desired and actual culture
where the company stands in comparison to industry averages

See the initial version here, contact me directly for more info on the more mature version.

title: D3.js Sankey Diagram
text:
Sankey diagrams created with D3.js

An interactive visualization of professional classes (operationalized by Oesch (2006a, 2006b, 2022)) to illustrate patterns in migration background, union membership status, professional class, income levels, vote recall, and gender in Germany between 2014 and 2023, using representative samples from the European Social Survey.
Available at https://mmuratardag.github.io/d3js_sankey_diagram_msc

Oesch, D. (2006a) “Coming to grips with a changing class structure” International Sociology 21 (2): 263-288.
Oesch, D. (2006b) “Redrawing the Class Map. Stratification and Institutions in Britain, Germany, Sweden and Switzerland”, Basingstoke: Palgrave Macmillan.
Oesch, D. (2022). Contemporary Class Analysis. JRC Working Papers Series on Social Classes in the Digital Age, 2022/01. European Commission, Joint Research Centre, Seville, JRC126506.

title: Moral Foundations Classifier
text:
A RoBERTa-based classifier designed to predict the presence of ten moral foundations within text

It can be used for various text analysis tasks, such as content analysis, opinion mining. The model was trained on a diverse corpus of text, including personal and political blogs, news media articles, essays, short stories, parliamentary debates, UN speeches & speeches by central bank presidents.
Model is available at https://huggingface.co/MMADS/MoralFoundationsClassifier
A web-app with a user-friendly interface is available at https://huggingface.co/spaces/MMADS/MoralFoundationsClassifier-app

title: Causal ML
text:
Causal modeling

Implementation of various causal modeling techniques to determine if living in the U.S. or Europe impacts developers’ overall job satisfaction. The methodological approach, involving doubleML, causal segmentation, and Bayesian learning networks, is deliberately inductive, allowing the different models to uncover distinct insights.
GitHub repo is here
Read the related blog post here

title: Common Vulnerabilities & Exposures Decoder for Different Professions
text:
CVE Dashboard with AI-Powered Audience Customization

A comprehensive Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) Dashboard designed to make vulnerability intelligence accessible and understandable to different audiences.
The dynamic dashboard provides real-time vulnerability monitoring by fetching data from the NIST National Vulnerability Database (NVD). Its standout feature is an AI-powered summarizer that leverages an LLM (Large Language Model) to translate complex vulnerability descriptions into actionable insights tailored for different professional audiences, such as data engineers, data scienctists, developers, managers, and security analysts.
The web-app is available at https://huggingface.co/spaces/MMADS/cve-decoder
